Cannot be recounted to You in order;

Sacrifice and offering You did not desire;

In the scroll of the book

I have proclaimed the good news of righteousness

I have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth

verse_parts.text: Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
I will open my mouth in a parable;
Which we have heard and known,
And our fathers have told us.
Telling to the generation to come the praises of the
And His strength and His wonderful works that He has done.
For He established a testimony in Jacob,
And appointed a law in Israel,
That they should make them known to their children;
That the generation to come might know
That they may set their hope in God,
And not forget the works of God,
And may not be like their fathers,
And whose spirit was not faithful to God.
Turned back in the day of battle.
They did not keep the covenant of God;
They refused to walk in His law,
And His wonders that He had shown them.
Marvelous things He did in the sight of their fathers,
He divided the sea and caused them to pass through;
And He made the waters stand up like a heap.
In the daytime also He led them with the cloud,
And all the night with a light of fire.
He split the rocks in the wilderness,
drink in abundance like the depths.
He also brought streams out of the rock,
And caused waters to run down like rivers.
But they sinned even more against Him
By rebelling against the Most High in the wilderness.
And they tested God in their heart
By asking for the food of their fancy.
They said, “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
So that the waters gushed out,
Can He provide meat for His people?”
So a fire was kindled against Jacob,
And anger also came up against Israel,
Because they did not believe in God,
And did not trust in His salvation.
Yet He had commanded the clouds above,
And opened the doors of heaven,
Had rained down manna on them to eat,
He caused an east wind to blow in the heavens;
And by His power He brought in the south wind.
He also rained meat on them like the dust,
Feathered fowl like the sand of the seas;
fall in the midst of their camp,
So they ate and were well filled,
For He gave them their own desire.
The wrath of God came against them,
And slew the stoutest of them,
In spite of this they still sinned,
And did not believe in His wondrous works.
Therefore their days He consumed in futility,
When He slew them, then they sought Him;
And they returned and sought earnestly for God.
And the Most High God their Redeemer.
Nevertheless they flattered Him with their mouth,
And they lied to Him with their tongue;
For their heart was not steadfast with Him,
Nor were they faithful in His covenant.
Yes, many a time He turned His anger away,
And did not stir up all His wrath;
A breath that passes away and does not come again.
Yes, again and again they tempted God,
And limited the Holy One of Israel.
The day when He redeemed them from the enemy,
When He worked His signs in Egypt,
And His wonders in the field of Zoan;
And their streams, that they could not drink.
He sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them,
He also gave their crops to the caterpillar,
And their labor to the locust.
He destroyed their vines with hail,
And their sycamore trees with frost.
He also gave up their cattle to the hail,
He cast on them the fierceness of His anger,
He made a path for His anger;
He did not spare their soul from death,
their life over to the plague,
And destroyed all the firstborn in Egypt,
strength in the tents of Ham.
But He made His own people go forth like sheep,
And guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
And He led them on safely, so that they did not fear;
But the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
And He brought them to His holy border,
He also drove out the nations before them,
And made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
Yet they tested and provoked the Most High God,
And did not keep His testimonies,
But turned back and acted unfaithfully like their fathers;
They were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
For they provoked Him to anger with their high places,
And moved Him to jealousy with their carved images.
So that He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,
The tent He had placed among men,
And delivered His strength into captivity,
And His glory into the enemy’s hand.
He also gave His people over to the sword,
And was furious with His inheritance.
The fire consumed their young men,
And their maidens were not given in marriage.
Their priests fell by the sword,
And their widows made no lamentation.
Like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
And He beat back His enemies;
He put them to a perpetual reproach.
Moreover He rejected the tent of Joseph,
And did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
But chose the tribe of Judah,
And He built His sanctuary like the heights,
Like the earth which He has established forever.
He also chose David His servant,
And took him from the sheepfolds;
From following the ewes that had young He brought him,
So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart,
And guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.

verse_parts.text: Make known His deeds among the peoples!
Sing to Him, sing psalms to Him;
Talk of all His wondrous works!
Let the hearts of those rejoice who seek the
Remember His marvelous works which He has done,
His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth,
O seed of Abraham His servant,
You children of Jacob, His chosen ones!
He commanded, for a thousand generations,
And confirmed it to Jacob for a statute,
Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
As the allotment of your inheritance,”
When they were few in number,
Indeed very few, and strangers in it.
When they went from one nation to another,
He permitted no one to do them wrong;
Yes, He rebuked kings for their sakes,
And do My prophets no harm.”
Moreover He called for a famine in the land;
He destroyed all the provision of bread.
He sent a man before them—
They hurt his feet with fetters,
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The king sent and released him,
The ruler of the people let him go free.
He made him lord of his house,
And ruler of all his possessions,
bind his princes at his pleasure,
And Jacob dwelt in the land of Ham.
And made them stronger than their enemies.
He turned their heart to hate His people,
To deal craftily with His servants.
They performed His signs among them,
And wonders in the land of Ham.
And they did not rebel against His word.
He turned their waters into blood,
in the chambers of their kings.
He spoke, and there came swarms of flies,
He gave them hail for rain,
He struck their vines also, and their fig trees,
And splintered the trees of their territory.
And ate up all the vegetation in their land,
And devoured the fruit of their ground.
destroyed all the firstborn in their land,

paragraphs_list.text: ע AYIN

verse_parts.text: I have done justice and righteousness;
Do not leave me to my oppressors.
Do not let the proud oppress me.
Deal with Your servant according to Your mercy,
That I may know Your testimonies.
More than gold, yes, than fine gold!

paragraphs_list.text: פ PE

verse_parts.text: The entrance of Your words gives light;
It gives understanding to the simple.
I opened my mouth and panted,
For I longed for Your commandments.
Look upon me and be merciful to me,
toward those who love Your name.
Direct my steps by Your word,
And let no iniquity have dominion over me.
Redeem me from the oppression of man,
That I may keep Your precepts.
Make Your face shine upon Your servant,
Rivers of water run down from my eyes,

paragraphs_list.text: צ TSADDE

verse_parts.text: Because my enemies have forgotten Your words.
I do not forget Your precepts.
Give me understanding, and I shall live.

paragraphs_list.text: ק QOPH

verse_parts.text: Save me, and I will keep Your testimonies.
I rise before the dawning of the morning,
My eyes are awake through the
That I may meditate on Your word.
Hear my voice according to Your lovingkindness;
, revive me according to Your justice.
They draw near who follow after wickedness;
They are far from Your law.
I have known of old that You have founded them forever.

paragraphs_list.text: ר RESH

verse_parts.text: Consider my affliction and deliver me,
For I do not forget Your law.
Plead my cause and redeem me;
Revive me according to Your word.
For they do not seek Your statutes.
Revive me according to Your judgments.
I do not turn from Your testimonies.
I see the treacherous, and am disgusted,
Because they do not keep Your word.
Consider how I love Your precepts;
And every one of Your righteous judgments

paragraphs_list.text: ש SHIN

verse_parts.text: Princes persecute me without a cause,
But my heart stands in awe of Your word.
As one who finds great treasure.
Seven times a day I praise You,
Great peace have those who love Your law,
Lit. they have no stumbling block
I keep Your precepts and Your testimonies,

verse_parts.text: Let my cry come before You, O
Give me understanding according to Your word.

For You teach me Your statutes.
My tongue shall speak of Your word,
Let Your hand become my help,
For I have chosen Your precepts.
I long for Your salvation, O
Let my soul live, and it shall praise You;
And let Your judgments help me.
I have gone astray like a lost sheep;
For I do not forget Your commandments.

verse_parts.text: Oh, give thanks to the God of gods!
Oh, give thanks to the Lord of lords!
To Him who alone does great wonders,
To Him who by wisdom made the heavens,
To Him who laid out the earth above the waters,
To Him who made great lights,
The sun to rule by day,
The moon and stars to rule by night,
To Him who struck Egypt in their firstborn,
And brought out Israel from among them,
With a strong hand, and with
To Him who divided the Red Sea in two,
And made Israel pass through the midst of it,
But overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea,
To Him who led His people through the wilderness,
To Him who struck down great kings,
And gave their land as a
A heritage to Israel His servant,
Who remembered us in our lowly state,
And rescued us from our enemies,
Who gives food to all flesh,
Oh, give thanks to the God of heaven!

content_parts.text: —Among the authors of the Psalms are David, the temple musicians, and Moses.
—Generally from 1000 BC, the time of David, to several centuries thereafter.
Each psalm has its own theme, as noted in the titles.
